node.title: France excludes UK from Channel migrants crisis meeting after criticism from British Prime Minister
node.description: France tells UK Home Secretary Priti Patel she is no longer invited to a meeting over the Channel migration crisis after British Prime Minister criticised Paris's handling of the situation.
node.content:
["The French government\u00a0has told UK Home Secretary Priti Patel she is no longer invited to a meeting over the Channel migration crisis after British Prime Minister Boris Johnson criticised Paris's handling of the situation.", "France took offence at a letter sent by Johnson to President Emmanuel Macron on Thursday.", "A source close to Interior Minister Gerald Darmanin described the letter as \"unacceptable and contrary to the spirit of our discussions between partners\".", "The decision underlined the poor post-Brexit relations between the two countries and the difficulties they might\u00a0face working together to curb the flow of migrants after 27 people drowned trying to reach British shores on Wednesday.", "\"[Mr] Darmanin told his counterpart she was no\u00a0longer welcome,\" a government spokesman for Mr\u00a0Darmanin told BFM TV.", "British officials in London said they\u00a0hoped Paris would reconsider.", "\"No nation can tackle this alone and so I hope that the French will reconsider,\" Transport Minister Grant Shapps told BBC News.", "When their dinghy deflated in the Channel earlier this week, 17\u00a0men, seven women and three teenagers died in\u00a0one of many such risky journeys attempted in small, overloaded boats by people fleeing poverty and war in Afghanistan, Iraq and beyond.", "", "
UK and France at odds on how to combat people smuggling.
", "It was the worst such tragedy on record in the narrow seaway separating Britain and France, which is one of the world's busiest shipping lanes.", "Mr Johnson said France was at fault and Mr Darmanin accused Britain of \"bad immigration management\".", "The deaths deepened animosity between Britain and France, already at odds over post-Brexit trade rules and fishing rights.", "French fishermen on Friday blocked a small British cargo vessel from docking in Saint-Malo and plan later to blockade the port of Calais and the Channel Tunnel, both major hubs for trade between Britain and Europe.\u00a0", "Reuters"]
